overview:
Larry Lenhart is an Executive-in-Residence at MDV pursuing initiatives and working with entrepreneurs in Cleantech, systems and software for the firm. He has eighteen years of leadership experience in growing and managing technology and service-based businesses with specific expertise in software, internet services and infrastructure technology. He is now working with Catilin.

Prior to MDV, Larry was the CEO of Requisite Technology, which was acquired by ClickCommerce. Larry has led two other companies that have been acquired by industry leaders: Affiliated Computer Services and i2 Technology. In 2000 Larry led CAT Technology to become the second fastest growing company in Silicon Valley with revenues of $170M. Prior to his CEO experience, Larry was a managing partner at Deloitte Consulting and AT Kearny where he provided strategic and operational services to industry leaders including EDS, AT&T, E-Trade, Novell, Prudential, Federal Express, GM, Saudi Aramco, Mobil, and DuPont among others

Larry is on the Board of Trustees for Emory and Henry College. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business and computer science from Emory and Henry College, where he received the Garnand Scholar award, and an MBA from the Darden School of Business at University of Virginia.
